faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about our AI Resume Review.

items.question: How does the AI Resume Review work?
items.answer: Our advanced AI analyzes your resume against thousands of successful job applications and industry standards. It checks for ATS compatibility, keyword optimization, formatting issues, and content quality to provide you with actionable feedback.

items.question: Is this service really free?
items.answer: Yes, our basic AI Resume Review is completely free. You can upload your CV and get an instant analysis score and key recommendations without paying a cent.

items.question: Is my data safe and private?
items.answer: Absolutely. We prioritize your privacy. Your uploaded CV is processed securely and is not shared with third parties or recruiters without your explicit permission.

items.question: What file formats do you support?
items.answer: We currently support PDF, DOCX (Word), and TXT files. For the best analysis results, we recommend uploading a PDF or DOCX file.

items.question: Can I edit my CV after the analysis?
items.answer: Yes! After the analysis, you can use our CV Builder to make improvements directly. We'll guide you through fixing the issues identified by the AI.

items.question: How accurate is the ATS score?
items.answer: Our ATS score is highly accurate and simulates the parsing algorithms used by major Applicant Tracking Systems. A high score (80+) significantly increases your chances of passing the initial screening.

star.title: STAR Method Builder
star.description: Create powerful, results-oriented bullet points by following the Situation, Task, Action, Result framework.

prompts.situation: What was the problem or challenge you faced?
prompts.task: What was your specific role or goal?
prompts.action: What technical solution did you implement? (languages, tools)
prompts.result: What was the quantifiable outcome? (performance, cost, users)

example.situation: Legacy e-commerce platform was suffering from 5s load times.
example.task: I needed to optimize frontend performance to improve conversions.
example.action: Rebuilt the core page using Next.js and aggressive caching.
example.result: Reduced load time by 60% and increased conversion by 15%.

prompts.situation: Describe an inefficient process or bottleneck.
prompts.task: What was the goal of the optimization?
prompts.action: What specific steps did you take to improve it?
prompts.result: How much time or money was saved?

example.situation: Manual data entry for reports took 20 hours per week.
example.task: Automate the reporting pipeline to save engineering time.
example.action: Developed a Python script using Pandas to auto-generate reports.
example.result: Saved 80+ hours monthly and eliminated entry errors.

prompts.situation: What was the team context or challenge?
prompts.action: How did you mentor, guide, or lead the team?
prompts.result: What was the impact on performance or morale?

example.situation: Junior developers were struggling with complex codebase.
example.task: Improve the onboarding process and code quality.
example.action: Implemented pair programming and created documentation.
example.result: Reduced onboarding time by 50% and decreased bug rate.

prompts.situation: What was the market condition or sales target?
prompts.task: What was your individual or team target?
prompts.action: What strategy did you use to close deals?
prompts.result: How much revenue did you generate?

example.situation: Sales targets were at risk due to new competitor.
example.task: Exceed the annual revenue target of $1M.
example.action: Developed new outreach targeting enterprise clients.
